title: Ticket #2766: Warn of restart-only config changes on reconfig
description:
Condor daemons should be aware of configuration settings where changes are ignored on a reconfig. If one of those settings changes, the daemon should note it and emit a warning that the change is being ignored to the log.

The daemon should always compare against the value seen at start up. That way if a confused admin runs condor_reconfig repeatedly, the warning will keep popping up.

Proposed message: 

09/26/11 13:56:19 Warning: Ignoring change of NUM_SLOTS from "2" to "4". You will need to restart this daemon for the change to take effect.

This came up in the LIGO discussion of #876; they suggested it would be helpful to be warned if a setting it being ignored on reconfig.
